name: Path T
title: Pathological T
notes:
**Note 1:**  When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and extension detail are available, record the code with extension detail in preference to a statement of FIGO stage. FIGO Stage IVA is assigned based on tumor extension and/or regional lymph node involvement.  Code CS Extension based on a physician's statement of FIGO Stage IVA if it is based on tumor extension or the basis is unknown.

**Note 2:**  FIGO no longer includes Stage 0 (Tis) for this site.

**Note 3:**  FIGO Stage I, IA and IB are defined by size of tumor, involvement of vulva OR vulva and perineum, and depth of stromal invasion.

**Note 4:**  The depth of invasion is defined as the measurement of the tumor from the epithelial-stromal junction of the adjacent most superficial dermal papilla to the deepest point of invasion.

**Note 5:** T3 is not used by FIGO. They label it T4. If you have a record which states T4, assign T3.
rows: Tumor greater than 2 cm or with stromal invasion greater than 1mm

Vulva and perineum:   Stromal invasion greater than 1 mm

FIGO Stage IB

Stated as T1b

Tumor of any size with extension to adjacent perineal structures: lower
third urethra, lower third vagina, anus

Anus
Perianal skin
Urethra:
     Lower/distal one-third 
    Urethra, NOS 
Vagina (lower/distal 1/3 vagina)
Vagina NOS

FIGO Stage II

Stated as T2

Tumor of any size with extension to the following structures:
Upper 2/3 urethra
Upper 2/3 vagina
Bladder mucosa
Rectal mucosa
Fixed to pelvic bone

Bladder wall or bladder, NOS (including mucosa)
Perineal body
Rectal wall or rectum, NOS (including mucosa)
Urethra: upper/proximal two-thirds
Vagina: upper/proximal two-thirds

Further contiguous extension

FIGO Stage IVA based on extension 
     Or unknown whether based on extension or nodes

Unknown; extension not stated

Carcinoma in situ (preinvasive carcinoma)
Intraepithelial neoplasia Grade III (VIN III)

Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension and with stromal invasion
no greater than 1.0 mm

Vulva and perineum:  Stromal invasion less than or equal to 1 mm

Stated as T1a
Tumor confined to vulva or vula and perinuem
